ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Re: crawl instance stopped crawling
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, Did you notice following lines in the log? It suggests your number-of-open-files-per-process limit is not high enough. Are you sure about your your system

Hi,

Did you notice following lines in the log? It suggests your
number-of-=
open-files-per-process limit is not high enough. Are you sure
about your yo=
ur system configuration? It appears like database is corrupted
when this ha=
ppens, but usually not in reality.

Caused by: java.io.FileNotFoundExceptio=
n:
/scratch/heritrix-3.1.1/jobs/2011-12-23/state/000a9cd9.jdb (Too many
ope=
n files)
at java.io.RandomAccessFile.open(Native Method)

--Kenji

On Tue, =
Jan 17, 2012 at 11:07 AM, David Pane <dpane@...> wrote:

> **
>
>
> =
Gordon,
>
> There wasn't any errors in the logs other than a few INFO and W=
ARNINGS.
> It just seemed to stop suddenly. I got impatient and I killed an=
d
> restarted the instance from the last checkpoint, before you responded.
=
> I couldn't pause the job or create a checkpoint so I forced the crawler
>=
 to stop.
>
> When I recovered from the checkpoint (which took over 1 hr) t=
he crawl
> started up normally, but after about 20 minutes of crawling the =
web
> interface became unresponsive. I couldn't get anything but the first
=
> line on the job page. (no pause, checkpoint terminate buttons or any Job
=
> is Active reporting.) The crawl did not seem to be ative based on the
> n=
etwork activity so I killed that it again and am restarting now.
>
> --Davi=

e. Finding the triggering
> > error could help determine how best to resume=
 and if there are any other
> > continuing risks on that node.

Hi,<div><br></div><div>Did you notice following lines in the log? It sugges=
ts your number-of-open-files-per-process limit is not high enough. Are you =
sure about your your system configuration? It appears like database is corr=
upted when this happens, but usually not in reality.=A0</div>
<div><br></di=
v><div>Caused by: java.io.FileNotFoundException:=A0<br>/scratch/heritrix-3.=
1.1/jobs/2011-12-23/state/000a9cd9.jdb (Too many=A0<br>open files)<br>at ja=
va.io.RandomAccessFile.open(Native Method)<br><br></div><div>--Kenji</div>
=

      <p>Gordon,<br>
<br>
There wasn't any errors in the logs othe=
r than a few INFO and WARNINGS. <br>
  It just seemed to stop suddenly.  I =
got impatient and I killed and <br>
restarted the instance from the last ch=
eckpoint, before you responded. <br>
I couldn't pause the job or create=
 a checkpoint so I forced the crawler <br>
to stop.<br>
<br>
When I recover=
ed from the checkpoint (which took over 1 hr) the crawl <br>
started up nor=
mally, but after about 20 minutes of crawling the web <br>
interface became=
 unresponsive.  I couldn't get anything but the first <br>
line on the =
job page. (no pause, checkpoint terminate buttons or any Job <br>
is Active=
 reporting.)  The crawl did not seem to be ative based on the <br>
network =
activity so I killed that it again and am restarting now.<br>
<br>
--David<=
